items.prompt: Which possessive adjective is used for 'She'?
items.explanation: We use 'Her' when something belongs to a woman or girl.

items.prompt: Complete the sentence: 'I ______ in the finance department.'
items.explanation: In the Present Simple, the base form of the verb is used with 'I'.

items.prompt: What is 'Laptop' in Spanish?
items.explanation: A laptop is a portable computer, known as 'ordenador portátil' in Spanish.

items.prompt: Which possessive adjective corresponds to 'We'?
Complete: 'This is Mr. Smith. ______ office is on the second floor.'
items.explanation: We use 'His' for the third person singular male (Mr. Smith).

items.prompt: What do you use to type emails?
items.explanation: A keyboard is the device used for typing text into a computer.

items.prompt: Choose the correct verb: 'They ______ work at 8:30 AM.'
items.explanation: With 'They', we use the base form 'start' in the Present Simple.

items.prompt: Which possessive is for 'Things' or 'Animals'?
items.explanation: 'Its' (without apostrophe) is the possessive adjective for things or animals.

items.prompt: Complete: 'Where is ______ pen? I can't find it.'
items.explanation: 'My' is the possessive adjective used before a noun (pen).

items.prompt: What do you use to move the cursor on the screen?
items.explanation: A computer mouse is used to control the cursor on a graphical user interface.

items.prompt: Select the correct sentence:
options: I is have a new laptop.
items.explanation: With 'I', the correct form of the verb to have is 'have'.

items.prompt: Possessive for 'You' (singular and plural):
What is 'Desk' in Spanish?
items.explanation: A desk is a piece of furniture used for working, called 'escritorio' in Spanish.

items.prompt: Complete: 'Mary and Paul are here. ______ laptops are on the table.'
items.explanation: We use 'Their' for the third person plural (Mary and Paul).

items.prompt: Choose the correct phrase: 'I ______ a meeting every Monday.'
items.explanation: 'I have' is the correct form for expressing a recurring event in the routine.

items.text: Every day, I [start] work at 9:00. I [use] my laptop and I [check] my emails.
items.explanation: Basic routine verbs in the first person singular.

items.text: This is [my] desk. That is [your] chair. [His] computer is new.
items.explanation: Using possessive adjectives to identify ownership of office objects.

items.text: We [work] for a big company. [Our] office is in Madrid. They [have] a meeting now.
items.explanation: Verb forms and possessive adjectives for 'We' and 'They'.

items.text:
A: Is this [your] keyboard?
B: No, it's [her] keyboard. My [laptop] is here.
items.explanation: Dialogue focusing on possessives and office objects.

items.text: I [have] a phone on my [desk]. I [use] it to call clients.
items.explanation: Describing the workspace and its use.

items.text: The company [is] Global Tech. [Its] logo is blue. [Their] employees are friendly.
In the morning, I [drink] coffee and [read] reports. My boss [is] Mr. Jones.
Is [his] name Robert? No, [his] name is Richard. [His] job is Sales Manager.
I [need] a new [mouse]. My [keyboard] is also very old.
You [have] a meeting at 10:00. Please [bring] [your] notebook.
She [is] a designer. [Her] office is creative. [Her] laptop is a Mac.
items.explanation: Using 'is' and 'her' for a female professional.

items.text: The [phone] is ringing. Please [answer] it. It's on [your] desk.
I [start] at 8:00 and I [finish] at 5:00. This [is] my daily routine.
We [use] a [printer] to print documents. [Our] printer is very fast.
They [are] in a meeting. [Their] phones [are] off. Please [wait] here.
items.explanation: Third person plural verbs and possessive.

items.title: My Work Day
items.text: My name is Elena. I work in an office in Valencia. I start my work at 8:30 AM. I have a big desk and a new laptop. I use my computer to write emails and organize files. At 11:00 AM, I have a meeting with my team. We discuss our projects.

vocabulary.definition: To arrange things in a structured way.
To talk about something with other people.

questions.question: What does she use to write emails?

items.explanation: Testing reading skills for workplace routines and objects.

items.title: The Tech Team
items.text: This is our IT department. Mark and Sophie work here. Mark is a developer. His laptop is very fast. Sophie is a technician. Her job is to help with computer problems. They use many keyboards and mice every day. Their office is very modern.

vocabulary.definition: A person who creates computer software.
A person skilled in technical equipment.

questions.question: Whose job is to help with computer problems?

items.explanation: Identifying roles and possessives in a short text.

items.title: A Clean Desk
items.text: Mr. Brown is very organized. His desk is always clean. He has a phone, a mouse, and a keyboard. He starts his routine by cleaning his screen. He says, 'My tools are important for my work.'

vocabulary.definition: Systematic and efficient.
Equipment used to perform a task.

items.explanation: Focusing on office objects and possessives.

items.title: The Morning Meeting
items.text: Every Tuesday, our company has a morning meeting. Our CEO, Mrs. Green, starts the meeting at 10:00. She uses a projector. We listen to her plans. Then, we go back to our desks.

vocabulary.definition: Chief Executive Officer, the highest-ranking person in a company.
A device that throws an image onto a screen.

items.explanation: Reading about company routines and hierarchy.

items.title: Office Supplies
items.text: We have a small room for office supplies. There are pens, notebooks, and paper. Their location is next to the kitchen. I go there to get a new mouse for my computer.

vocabulary.definition: Materials or items needed for a particular purpose.
A particular place or position.

items.explanation: Locating items in an office environment.

items.title: New Laptop
items.text: I have a new laptop. Its color is silver. Its screen is very big. I love my new computer. It is very light and I take it to all my meetings.

vocabulary.definition: A shiny grey-white color.
Not heavy; easy to carry.

items.title: Work from Home
items.text: Today, I work from home. My desk is in my living room. I use my home Wi-Fi. My routine is the same: I start at 9:00 and finish at 6:00.

vocabulary.definition: Wireless network connection.
A sequence of actions regularly followed.

items.title: The Shared Office
items.text: This is a shared office. Many people work here. Their desks are close to each other. They use laptops because they move a lot. Our company likes this space.

vocabulary.definition: Used by more than one person.
An area or location.

items.title: Lunch Break
items.text: At 2:00 PM, we have our lunch break. We go to a cafe near our office. Their sandwiches are excellent. We return to our work at 3:00 PM.

vocabulary.definition: Extremely good; outstanding.
To come or go back to a place.

questions.question: What time is the lunch break?

items.explanation: Reading about daily work schedule breaks.

items.title: Email Routine
items.text: I write many emails every day. My first task in the morning is to check my inbox. I reply to my clients and my boss. Then, I organize my folders.

vocabulary.definition: The main folder where new emails arrive.
To answer someone.

questions.question: What is the first task in the morning?

items.question: Match the pronoun with the correct possessive adjective.
Match the plural pronoun with the correct possessive adjective.
Match the office object with its Spanish translation.
Match the verb with its object or complement.
items.explanation: Common collocations in a work context.

items.question: Match the action with the time (from the theory/examples).
items.explanation: Relating actions to typical schedule times.

items.question: Match the subject with the correct form of the verb 'to have'.
Match the workplace tool with its function.
Match the professional with their possessive adjective.
Match the workplace greeting with the time.
items.explanation: Reviewing greetings in a routine context.

items.question: Match the job with the typical department.

items.text:
A: Hello, is this [your] desk?
B: No, it's [his] desk. Mr. Garcia works here.

A: Where is [my] laptop?
B: It's in [your] bag. Check it!

A: Does Mary [have] her mouse?
B: Yes, she [has] it on her desk.

A: What time do you [start] work?
B: I [start] at 8:00 AM every day.

A: Is the meeting in [our] office?
B: No, it's in [their] office on the third floor.

A: This computer is very slow. [Its] screen is old.
B: You [need] a new laptop.

A: Do they [work] in London?
B: No, they [work] in Manchester. [Their] office is big.
items.explanation: Information exchange about location and company.

items.text:
A: I [use] a Mac for [my] design work.
B: I [use] a PC for my spreadsheets.

A: Please [write] the report now.
B: I [have] a meeting in 5 minutes. Is [it] okay later?

A: [Our] company [is] growing.
B: Yes, [its] reputation is very good.

items.prompt: Write a sentence using 'my' and an office object (e.g., laptop, desk).
items.modelAnswer: My laptop is on my desk.

items.prompt: Write a sentence about your morning routine at work using the verb 'start'.
Look at the subject 'She'. Write a sentence about her office using a possessive adjective.
List three office objects you use every day in English.
Translate to English: 'Nuestra empresa es moderna'.
Change the sentence to use 'Their': 'The workers have laptops'.
items.explanation: Transforming sentences to use possessive adjectives.

items.prompt: Write a question to ask someone what time they start work.
items.modelAnswer: What time do you start work?

items.prompt: Write a sentence about a company using 'its'. (e.g., logo, name).
Describe what you use to write an email in one sentence.
items.modelAnswer: I use my keyboard to write an email.

items.prompt: Translate to English: 'Tengo una reunión a las diez'.
items.modelAnswer: I have a meeting at ten.

items.prompt: Which sentence is correct?
Choose the correct verb: 'We ______ many emails every morning.'
items.explanation: With 'We', we use the base form 'write'.

items.title: Daily Schedule
items.transcript: I start my work at nine o'clock. I usually check my emails first, and then I have a meeting with my manager at eleven.

questions.question: What time does the speaker start work?
questions.explanation: The transcript says: 'I start my work at nine o'clock'.

items.title: Office Ownership
items.transcript: Is this your desk, Sarah? No, it's his desk. My desk is near the window.

items.title: New Equipment
items.transcript: We have a new printer in our office. Its name is PrintFast 500. It is very quiet.

questions.question: What is new in the office?
questions.explanation: The speaker says: 'We have a new printer'.
